alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Natural Fort, or 11 miles southwest of Cheyenne, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Laramie County. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 4. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
